page.title: 03Shillington 3
page.content: Generations of Ansells, Hydes, Hares, Jenkins, Ingreys, Wilsons, Ingrams, Coles, Coopers and Harrises have attended the village schools, but Shillington is not a parochial village. Its just that once having lived here, people often "come home to roost." This is not a "pretty postcard" sort of village. It has developed a lot over the years, red brick houses, white thatched cottages and small estates all make up the patchwork of the community. People have moved in from far and wide, everyone finds it easy to slot into village life.
